solution.text:
If p(x) is a polynomial in x, the highest power of x in p(x) is called the degree of the polynomial p(x)
Just by looking at the expression \(_{j}_x^{_{{l-1}}_}+x^{_{l}_}+_{k}_\) , the highest power is _{l}_
Therefore we can say the polynomial is of degree _{l}_

content.text: Find the degree of the given polynomial :\(f(x)=_{j}_x^{_{{l-1}}_}+x^{_{l}_}+_{k}_\)
